text: On tap at Oceanside Ale Works, pours a cloudy deep dark amber with a small beige head. Aroma brings out bready malt, toasted caramel and some hop resins. Flavour is rich with caramel and resinous hops upfront, with a very bitter finish. Nicely constructed and well-balanced. Solid.
Poured ruby red, real clear, malty caramel aroma with some peppery hops evident. Extremely malty with very light toast and a pretty thick finish without being too viscous.

Bomber purchased at Holiday Wine Cellar 1.5 years ago ($5.99). POURS a nice deep amber / muddy brown hue with a good two fingers of off-white foam that soon reduces. AROMA of creamy nutty chocolate, toasted dark bread, caramel, and port wine-like sticky dark fruity notes. FLAVOR diverges somewhat from the nose with initial hoppy-fruity notes ("legacy" hops after 1.5 years), followed by more malt-centric notes of mild chocolate, honeyed bread, brown sugar, toffee/caramel, and some stewed dark fruits. Hides the alcohol reasonably well. (89, 1023)

Bomber from the Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours copper with a yellowish foamy head. Aroma suggests a lot of hop and brown sugar. Med body at best. Flavor is brown sugar and hops that arent too bitter. Very smooth. Nice, but not really exciting. Fair amount of hop, but it takes a long time to show strong bitter.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours orange amber with a huge beige head that lowered itself pretty quickly, and a honey and malt aroma. There is a slightly astringent yet sweet mixed malt flavor with a dry moderately bitter finish.

Bottle (22 oz) shared at tasting. Clear amber with a smal lwhite head leaving little lacing. Flavor is rather dull and raw with resinous hops, caramel, lots of alcohol for the abv, medium spiciness and toasted notes. Taste is sweet and boozy with a moderate piney bitterness. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Spicy and boozy finish. Malty but lacking malt depth. Boozy for no reason. Bitter without fun hoppy features. Raw, lack of refinement. Poorly executed.
Bouteille 650ml, bottle share. Couleur cuivrée translucide, mousse beige. Arôme de malt caramélisé, alcool, noix. Goût de malt caramélisé, alcool. Carbonatation faible, corps moyen.

Clear deep amber gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is super malty, very boozy, red fruits. Taste is lightly sweet, lots of caramel, brown sugar, very sweet. Palate is med full bodied with light carbonation. Good.

pours unclear bright red, burnt orange, with a small off-white cap offering some retention and lacing. sweet fruity maltiness, melanoidin, some rotten red fruitiness, chalky resin, orange jelly, doughy and sweaty grains. modearte carbonation, medium body - oily; sweet and spicy finish. scattered.

Poured tap at source. Clear dark red. Like a garnet jewel. Aroma of toffe malts no roast. Some hops present but all about malty aroma. Super fresh malty toffe taste with the 9+ percent alcohol hidden. Finishes well with no sweetness, just malty joy.

22 oz bomber bottle, Statue of Liberty on bottle with pre-amble of constitution. How could I not rate this 100 th beer on sept 11. Pour dark garnet and super clear wonderful color with thick white head. Malts in aroma of biscuit caramel and toffee with a slight plum character. Flavor slightly sweet with noise of dark dried fruits and some sherry notes as well. Hops come in to balance out with some alcohol heat along with it.

From bomber to tulip. Aroma of biscuit malt dominates. Alcohol is fully present on the aroma - a little solventy. Hop aroma provides wet grass and a pleasant mixtures of herbs and spices. Pours a clear orange-amber with tan head that leaves slight lacing down the glass. Taste is herbacious, mostly wild herbs in an overgrown grass meadow. Plenty of residual sweetness leads to a cloying, textured mouthfeel. Moderate low bitterness adds nice balance.

Extreme malty beer. Had at brewery for summer party now! Malty richness alcohol subdued. Not a 9.4 tasting beer but effective. Hops are appear to but the malts dominated this beer. Not what I expected since it was a red clear pour and not a big stout like beer. Not risstiness just rich malts.
22oz bottle pours a pale brown color with a lot of frothy head. Full malty flavor and nice hop balance. Some floral flavors. Noticeable alcohol.

Bottle. Pours hazy deep amber, large beige head, dissipates fairly slowly, pretty good lacing. Aroma is dusty, hoppy, floral, pine, perfume. Flavor is medium sweet, medium bitter, some dark sugars, strong pine, perfumy almost. Medium body, some astringence and lingering bitterness. Hmmm.
Deep red with a white head. Full of malty goodness balanced with intense hops. A very competing beer but it works. Full bodied. Sweet hoppy finish.

Bottle from Bonita: When I saw this beer and read American strong ale there was going to be no ifs, ands, or buts about buying it. One of my favorite styles. Poured a dark burnt orange hue that was hazy and difficult to see through the liquid because of how much sediments has been stirred up. Created a thick large foam head which eventually retreated. As for the carbonation bubbles, a violent abruption of bubbles rise to the top and appeared as though it was a home brewed beer. Nose is bold with chewy malts and hops and reminds me so much of an arrogant bastard ale or the smell of a hoppy barleywine style. Aroma has traces of wood, earth, grained wheat, oats, and a pinch of hops. Upon my first sip, an initial taste of tart and bitter flavors come across as if this was an expired beer although it shows it was bottled exactly 2 months ago. I dont get what is going on with this beer because something is very off. The beer taste extremely bitter yet has an upfront sweetness that is confusing on my tongue as I am making sour faces during each sip. Definitely one of those beers to take sips cautiously because of the high alcohol content, but in my case it tends to be mainly because the flavor is off for me.

It seems that there are a lot of "shill" reviews for this beer, so I intentionally rated it a little lower to help balance the scale. For a beer to be rated so much above 4 over and over is suspicious and not reliable. Ruby red/orange pour with a nice, thick, white head that retains and leaves slight lacing. Aroma of caramel, grain, earthy, fruity, slight vegetable. Really nice overall, but not a world class beer as the ratings would indicate. A bit too bitter, but what do you expect from an American Strong? Too one dimensional, not enough focus on the yeast and malt flavors.

Aroma: complex amber malts and earthy hops.
Appearance: dark red and clear and thick head great lacing
Taste: malts and more rich malts with some raisin and earthy hop finish
Palate: thick clean malts with alcohol in back bone.
Overall: malty and well balance hops background.

Smell of malts and caramel. Taste biscuit with overlay of complex and different mild malts. Absolutely no roast just caramel and some molasses notes. Rounds up with a hop bitterness, mostly earthy and pepper spice hops.

First off, I am waaay skeptical about those 10 previous ratings for this beer. Especially considering how tight the data are and the fact that not one of those users has even close to over 100 ratings. But I digress... 22oz bomber was my weapon of choice. The pour is a light copper color and a faint haze through the center. Frothy white lacing settles to a fine 2mm layer of sticky foam. The aroma is mostly fruity esters of peach, mash syrup, hops and buttery diacetyl. Flavor is strong alcohol and sweetness up front with a solid bitterness following. Lots of caramel and toffee flavors. Finishes very strong and warm, not leaving much wiggle room to taste any other deeper flavors. I also get a bit of maple syrup and vegetable somewhere in there. Overall its an ass-kicker and a slow sipper, but still fairly enjoyable.

At the Draft in Oceanside. Big huge beer red garnet color, tan head and great lacing on glass. Mostly malt aroma minimal hops. Flavor is fairly dry for malty beer when hops do peak through. Biscuit toffee flavor with some roast. Alcohol hidden as was told it was bigger than nine percent. Excellent.

22oz bomber. Malt aroma huge even out of bottle poured garnet amber clear. Hop presence popped trough on pour of earthy hops. Flavor rich but nit sweet. Excellent malt balance of toffee, and biscuit. World class.

Tasting round at brewer, fantastic rich aromas malts cocoa, bittersweet chocolate taste and balance of hops and malts are perfect, slightly sweet in a good way. And surprisingly enough a good clean drier finish than initial taste up front. Great 9.2%

Now after having blonde at source blender gave me this malt bomb. Unreal! So much fricking flavor from light roast coffee and caramel. 9.+ percent yet oh so so smooth. Super great mouth feel a big dinner in glass.

Another bottle 22 bomber thanx to Mel4vegas...so nice sweet malty aroma, super big rich mouthfeel without being too sweet, the hops helped dry it out to a perfect balance, 9.2 holy crap i am going to feel it.

Sharing 22 bomber with Sarapeaches....excellent malt caramel tiny roast aroma, flavor of mellow toffe and Carmel ....really rich and great mouthfeel and carbonation. Not flat like many big brews. Packs in high ABV but doesnt taste so. Greatness.

Had their Dude so had to try this, 22 oz...totally different than dude, this one leans heavily on malt side in a big way, aroma of caramel toffee and some hops, more noble hop profile it seems, big big huge mouth feel and great carbonation without the pillow head, helps aromas come through. 9.2 big great brew!
There best! Stay away from their light brews and stick with the bigguns. This one is super rich malt nose and tons of fricking flavor. Tap version is killer, been enjoying this for ever.

Having at brewery...2 bucks...holy crap...this has so much fricken flavor...malts X19 and hops as well..only doing one at 9.2 Ill be done. Great carbonation for such a thick rich brew....good thing I have DD

Bought this 22 oz bomber from a liquor store in the 92008. Had to because their collab braggot was so awesome!!!This was a malt forward brew. Caramel richness and waffle taste. Picked up great spicy hops through the whole experience. Could not tell it was 9%+. Fantastico!!!

Poured at GABF 2014...my husband and I were voluntary pourers. This brew was a wonderful malty beer. Very smooth and even for the posted 9.2% This one will get you in trouble, good thing for the one ounce pours. Nice hop bitterness, and malty dry finish.

Pours a dark amber color with a malt and alcohol aroma. Tatse is of caramel and sweet malt. Good alcohol flavor throughout the beer especially as it warmed. A little black licorice flavor mixed well with the sweet flavor. A nice beer that warmed the chest as it went down.

Big big beer in the 22 oz bomber....cool cap!!! Crystal clear garnet color, Huge malt aroma, and hops to back up big rich caramel and toffe notes. Very minimal alcohol notes suprising since labeled 9+%. Greta brew and pretty good price at 6.99 for the big brew.

"A pretty nice beer, but it kinda lacks focus, not fitting any style and coming off good, but muddled. The oaked treatments of this were quite nice, this base beer was above average with light citrus notes, ample bitterness and malty sweetness to balance. Hides the abv well."

22 oz bomber from liquor store in Encinitas. No this a true to style ASA. It does have a nice hop aroma more to the earthy side but the malt dominates. The flavor is caramel and biscuit with very very alcohol warmth. Finishes malty then dry.

76th rating seems appropriate for this brew...Rich maly caramel aroma. Nice light head, kept carbonation well for such a rich brew. predominately malt centric. slight alcvohol warmth that I really enjoyed A+++++

Pours dark garnet amber crystal clear. Great caramel aroma with a slight hop earthyness. Not citrus more pepper hop flavor and aroma. Flavor leans more towards the caramel and malts. Big, big brew. Loved it ...

On tap at brewery, visiting my brother this is his fav place. Blonde no good but this one the American Syrong was excellent. Not much aroma but the flavor was incredible. Rich thick malty. Never had a beer quite like this. Thumbs up!
UPDATED: APR 13, 2014 Very strong brew here, 9.2%, on tap at the LA Beer Festival 2014, copper in color, fruity nose with citrus, pines and apricots in flavor, malty finish.

Tasted on draft.  Hazy golden color with a cream colored  head with decent lacing. Aroma of grapefruit and alcohol. Full-bodied with a front end hop flavor and fruit flavor. Very enjoyable with the pizza that I had it with.

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a thin white head. The aroma has notes of malt, wheat, and peaches. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, fruit, and hay, leading to a dry finish where the hay note lingers. Very malty.Earlier Rating: 11/17/2010 Total Score: 3.2Draft. A hazy reddish-amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has strong notes of fruits - primarily peaches, combined with medium notes of yeast, and light notes of spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, straw, fruit, alcohol, and yeast, leading to a dry finish where the notes of yeast, fruit, and wheat lingers. It has a strong body.
Aroma had roasted malt, caramel, hops and yeasty notes. Flavor had roasted malt, caramel, dark fruits, hops and yeasty notes. Finished dry and bitter.
Clear amber color/ fleeting head. Sweet caramel nutty roasty aromas. medium body. Sweet brown sugar, pine sap, nutty cocoa flavors. good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
A: The pour is a light brown color with a thin white head.

S: A light hoppiness to it, but quite a bit of chocolate and caramel malt.

T: Not quite as sweet as I would have thought, but still a fair amount of caramel and dark fruits.

M: Kind of light on the tongue for a "big" beer. Good level of carbonation, but still, a bit thin on the feel.

D: Not terrible, but I dont know if Id want to drink it again either.

From tap at the brewery. Pours orange with a smal orange colours with a small white head. Light malty aroma with a mild cornish touch and crisp bitterness coming through.smooth and malty with a smooth hoppy bitterness coming through into the far finish. Smooth and dry.Earlier Rating: 8/2/2009 Total Score: 3.4From tap at breakwater. Pours hazy dark orange with a small and lacing white head. Light fruity and malty aroma. Solid caramelish malt flavour with a hoppy bitterness and downplayed fruity note. Ends dry and yet somewhat malty finish.

On tap. Almost clear golden with an off-white head. Very fruity almost perfumy aroma. Medium body, sweet fruits and malt while the bitterness only comes late. The alcohol is very well hidden. 080709Earlier Rating: 7/27/2009 Total Score: 3.8On tap. Slightly hazy amber golden with a creamy off-white head leaving laces. Lots of fruit in the nose with yeast and distinct alcohol. Very full-bodied with lots of fruit - almost perfumy - and a light yeastiness. Ends sweet with no bitterness. Excellent! 080709

Draft. Amber beer with a whitish head. Light grapefruit and light malt aroma. Grapefruit and light pine flavor with light summer fruits and a light graininess. Medium bodied. OK bitterness. Grapefruit and light pine lingers with light woodsiness and light malt.

A very malt intense beer with a god balance between the hops and malts.  The Strong ale is delicious and a must drink while I was trying the strong I was told to try a strong blonde and I must say that is just amazing.

On tap at stone.  Clear light amber with white head.  Nose is light.  Sweetness, with a bit of alcohol.  Taste is rather light too.  Not what I expect from the style.  Not sure what Id call it, but didnt seem to match the name.  Sweet, malty, and clear alcohol.
On tap an Pizza Port Carlsbad.  Pours a dark, clear amber with off-white head.  Sweet and malty with a nice hop backbone.  Caramel, toffee, candy sugar, hints of fruit, and resinous hops.

On tap @ Stone Brewing World Bistro and Gardens 01.06.09.  Dark orange amber, clear, almost no head at all. Boozy nose with some melon fruit. Very reminiscent of a euro strong lager. Fruity sugary malts, almost syrupy, with hot alcohol and medium bitterness in the finish. This one didnt come together for me.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Draft at Stone Bistro. Poured a slightly hazy amber with a slight white head. Fruity and malty nose. Flavors very similar, some nice subtle hop flavors too with some caramel hints. Pretty good.

On-tap at Breakwater. Pours cloudy amber with a moderate white head, great lace. Smells big and sweet malty, slightly fruity with slight alcohol as well. Tastes suprisingly cereal malty but also dark and caramelly malty sweet as well. Full body, good carbonation.

On draught at Breakwater Brewing in Oceanside. This beer pours a hazy orange-amber color with a thin white head that diminishes steadily. Stringy lacing on the glass. Malty aroma with some medicinal notes, and mild hops. Rich and sweet mouthfeel with flavors of roasted malt, piney hops and caramel. Touches of dark fruit here and there too. The finish is sweet and malty with a lingering warming alcohol aftertaste. Pretty good all around.
An old rating i finally got to entering. Aroma was not bad. Light hoppiness but not overly hopped. Seemed more liek an IPA and not  a barleywine. A little cloying and sweet.

Great brew scene on my visit to San Diego. This brew was quite unique but none the less absolutely awesome. Big malt nose with some hops in the back ground. Very malty nutty and a very hoppy finish without extreme bitterness. I read 9.2% on this page?? Seems high. Greta finish
could be the best beer of all time its the malts bomb of malts bombs in my words it is just dank perfect amount of hops and at 9.2 it is perfect for a good buzz

Growler, courtesy of kmweaver. Attractive, clear copper with an off-white head. Very light grapefruit, pine and wood in the nose. Flavor starts with grapefruit, pine then gets pretty metallic and astringent - reminded me of one of my recent homebrewed IPAs that I didnt care for. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and moderate carbonation.

@ bar in O-Side Ps &Qs or somethin like that. Very clear orange with foamy head. Very piney citrus and slight pepper nose. Flavour slightly nutty, very malty but not sweet, and crisp hop finish. Much like a double IPA?? But I guess an American (Northwest) Strong GREAT brew.(Didnt think it was quite 9.2 until I finished a quart...eys its 9.2)
On tap at brewery.  Golden amber with no head.  Sweet malty citrus aroma.  Citrus, caramel, and mild brown sugar taste and a crisp bready finish.

Tap at the Back Street Vista location: Coppery hue with a small frothy head and good lace. The aroma has notes of biscuity and caramel malts, grassy and citric hops, leafy and earthy, a hint of chocolate and pepper. The taste is fruity and malty with a moderate bitter and peppery finish. A tad phenolic as well . The mouth feel is lively and aggressive with a dry chalky finish. A very drinkable brew.

Sample provided by kmweaver. Hazy, light amber body with a small white head. The nose is toasty biscuits with light citrus. The flavor is fairly dry with lots of biscuits/dough, grapefruits and apricots. Medium is fairly thin with light carbonation.

Growler courtesy of wetherel . Hazy deep orange pour with a frothy yellowed off white head. Aroma of caramel malt, earthy hops, and a bit of lemon. Flavors of citrus/pine hops, caramel, and lemon zest. Medium body, bitter with a bitter/dry finish.

C-Bus 9 shared by nolankowal: Growler: Pours a clear orange amber with an off white head. Aroma, caramel and brown sugar with some earthy and piny hops to it. Flavor, caramel and some sweet malts up front with an earthy, piny bitterness on the finish. Pretty solid.

Thanks for sharing Ken.  Soft amber, creamy khaki head.  Nose was subdued with piney grapefruit and florals that warm to grainy chocolate and cereal-like tones.  Light bitter metallic flavors balance on a soft grainy caramel notes.  ABV shines brightly here.  Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry, bittersweet finish.  Has potential, but could use some recipe tweaking to pull it all together
From kmweavers grower, cloudy yellow with nice carbonation (hard to believe it was bottled over a week previous to the tasting!) Hoppy and cheerful, I would have it again

From a growler it pours a hazy honey color.  A bit of hay, some cherry flavored malts, some dull hops, the bitterness being on about the APA level, then it has some toasted grains, with some coarse and biting burnt cracker and honey flavored malts.  Interesting, but nothing great.  Lacks decent aromatic hops, and the bitterness is quite low, again on the level of pale ale.

(growler, thanks kmweaver) Medium off-white head atop hazy amber body.  Aroma is medium sweet, grapefruit, light acetone.  Taste is medium sweet, grapefruit, some earthy, light caramel.  Quite bitter.  Medium body, light acidity.

Growler, courtesy of wetherel.  Thanks, John!  Pours a bright, yellowish-amber color; fluffy, off-white head with fine-bubbled retention; this held its carbonation quite well.  Earthy, fruity hops and tea-like malts in the aroma; soft, minimal show of alcohol.  Medium-to-full, chewy mouthfeel: definitely malt-forward, with some earthiness and tea-like malts; good balancing bitterness, but nothing remarkable in the hop character; tastes like 7 or 8% at most, so if this is more its well-hidden.  Medium, tea-like malts and fruit in the finish; some dry earthiness.

Poured from a growler.  Marginally clear, dull orange.  Aroma of burnt and buttered popcorn, wet wood, and salted grapefruit.  Pungent and ugly.  Taste has more of the same dirty tea leaf bitterness, salt, and vodka poured into old orange juice.  Papery and extremely poorly attenuated.  No life on the palate; flat and tired, highlighting the booze.  A very difficult drinker.  Almost utterly undrinkable, in fact, and a fairly complete disappointment.  Thanks for sharing, Ken.

Many thanks to wetherel for sending me the growler!!!  Poured translucent coppery-amber with a tall-ish cap of off-white head.  Holy Hops on the aroma!.. grapefruit, pine, and floral representin well with deep caramel, some toffee, and lighter fruity notes backing it up.. delightful!  The flavor was just as solid.. rich caramel, grapefruit meat, and medium-bodied fruits paired with huge hoppage again (grapefruit and pine standing out).. sweet overall with a warm finish that picked up some drier fruit and dusty hops.  Creamy and fuller-bodied on the palate with soft carbonation.. great balance between the malty base and the huge hops.. warm and satisfying finish.  Great!

Growler shared by Jason.  The beer pours to a reddish amber body with a tall creamy dense yellowish-khaki head.  The aroma is extremely hoppy with tons of citrus, grapefruit, IIPA like aromas.  Spruce.  The flavor is extremely malty and nicely hoppy.  Rich toasted malts.  Bitter pine and spruce, grapefruit, and toast.  The palate is nicely bitter, medium bodied.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2007 Date: 12/01/2006
Mode: Draft
Source: Brewfest, Strong Ale Fest

hazy amber, nice fine beige head, 
rich sweet caramel malt aroma with earthy hops, 
lots of earthy hop flavor, dry caramel malt to balance, 
-------- />
Date: 11/29/2007
Mode: draft
Score: 3.0 to 3.1
Words: back street vista

clear amber, frothy dirty white head, solid drippy lace, 
sweet and spicy malt aroma, 
rich malt flavor, candy sweetness is balanced by the spicy character, good earthy hops, light bitter finish, 

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 12/20
Rating: 3.1/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *4

This was the most interesting brew I have had...in a good way, expecting a Arrogant bastard type of brew yet it was lighter in the malt, expecting and IPA or double IPA this brew was not bitter YET real hoppy???? Cant believ it was a 9.2 unitl I Finished EXCELLEN BREW

On tap at the Stone Bistro on 12/1/06: Pours a clear copper orange with a frothy well-lacing white head.  Aroma of fresh citrusy hops, waterchestnuts and some sweet toasty pale malt.  Body starts sweet and malty with a good amount of spruce and piny hop balance toward a crisp, bittersweet finish that hides the alcohol well.  Fairly drinkable for a strong ale.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2007 Rerate:  The first time I rated this, it was my 4th rating, and I was less experienced at rating.  I tried it at the brewery again.  Everyone should visit their brewery, its fun!  1" small bubble head. Nice hoppy aroma.  Amber color.  Well blalanced with a lean toward the hoppy side, kinda of like an IPA.  West coast hop grapefruit bitterness.  Nice.

Old rating:  I visited the oceanside ale works for a tasting.  It was fun with many people (~20) drinking and talking.  I was looking forward trying this one.  All american strong ales are great, but this one was just good, so relatively speaking its rating was brought down. 6-4-7-3-12:3.2

Pours amber orange with a small light tan and a film of lace. A dominant citrus hop aroma with an underlying earthiness and hop flavor without the strict bitterness. Creamy while hopped medium malt structure slight toastiness with a nice amount of carbonation that adds to a very satisfying complexity.

Clear deep amber color with a large off-white head.  The aroma was sweet and fruity with yeasty and estery notes.  Some apples.  The flavor was fruity with a light bitterness on the finish.  Some warmth in the chest.

PP Strg Ale Fst, gold to copper, sligh fruity nose with big resin citrus pine and apricot, finished by a biscut toast malt. Flavor paralled the nose malt did an exceptional job at balacing the heavy resin hops. Great carbonation, mouthfeel and silk on glass. Slight bitter astringency on the finish...made it crisp and clean

Tasted on tap at the 2006 Pizza Port Strong Ale Fest. This strong ale pours a medium gold color. Small sized white foamy head. Aroma is orange and malt, fruity and sweet. A medium bodied American Strong Ale. Malts are fruity and sweet. There are lots of orange and citrus flavors. Some caramel malts as well. Hops are citrus and grapefruit. Nice balance. Good carbonation. Touch of alcohol bite, but only a little bit in the aftertaste. Nice beer. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

Aroma: Rich and complex, with variable amounts of roasted grains, maltiness, fruity esters, hops, and alcohol.  The malt aroma  to rich and barleywine-like,  shows a slight specialty malt character (e.g., caramel), Fruity esters take on a complex, character.  Hop aroma quite aggressive An alcohol character present, 
Mouthfeel: Full to very full-bodied and chewy, with a velvety, luscious texture Gentle smooth warmth from alcohol present and noticeable.  Overall Impression: An intensely flavored, big, ale.

Draft at OBriens.  Dark amber with a decent head.  Lots of citrus and fruity aroma.  Hops were evident, but not grassy or piney.  Flavor was more malty with a definite hop bitterness on the finish.  Still fruity hops.  Mouthfeel was very creamy and cask like.  Very smooth with some definite alcohol flavor and a tiny bit of burn.  Not Bad.
At Obreins, Great citris aroma...hits you in the face. Hop aroma up front malt in the middle then big oily hops in the finish. Very well done for a 9.2%
Tap, OBriens. Medium amber pour. Slightly sweet citric hoppy aroma. Hops up front. A little lacking in the middle. Finishes up with a bit of citric hoppiness.

Sample on [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */Briens:  Nice amber color with a small yellowish head. Aroma of honey and alcohol. Flavor has honey, caramel and a lightly grassy bitterness. Full bodied and creamy with moderate carbonation.

At a pub in Carlsbad called Tom Giblins, served in a british style pint glass. Humungous hop aroma, extremely pleasant !!! First sip not too bitter as I may have expected from the hop aroma. More than just a pale with tons of hops, plenty of other mild type roast and malt character. Left a giant hop (Not Bitter Hop) but hop flavor in the end. Slight alcohol warmth on the back of the throat.  A splendid effort and top notch ale

Amber, haze...cleared as glass warmed, slight floral hop nose, hoppy bitterness flowed by a huge wave of impressive malts. Five bucks a pint (OUCH) bartender said it was due to 9+ percent..didnt really think it was 9 until I had my second. Did not taste like wine or cider which was excellentt due to high %so although it did not seem like a good value it really was...amiable inception...baroque flavor in malts...solid finish...may be my highest rated

3736 strong ale? dark orange and heavy malt caramel aroma with slight pepper. Absolutely huge flavor on first sip, not alcohol but huge something, hard to believe 9.2% like most persons who make jet exaust. Big on expansion in the tounge and mouth, almost creamy.Just great big brew flavor, most enjoyable!!!

On Tap in Calsbad Pizza Port: On Tap-3736(?), nobody knew what the numbers meant after next to the name on the chalkboard) Nice, deep amber color; bready malt and not alot of hop charactor, maybe some musty and flowery hops; well balanced and not terribly strong; good brew, but a fairly mild American strong.

On tap at pizza Port Carlsbad. Porued a copper orange with pure white dense head and finger lacing.  First sip very strong carmel no for the weak, in fact unless you have a crown by your name do not try this beer. Extreme hop flavor without citrus bitterness just loads on hop oil flavor. Extreme carmel malt flavor not sweet not to dry. Very big mouthfeel, coats your tounge and mouth for ever and perfect balance of big malt an big hops. I have rated very few at 5 this is almost there but it needs more hop aroma.
